intro: Loxostachys, commonly known as the desert grass or sand grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Mongolia and China. The plants are characterized by their tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Loxostachys species often have deep root systems that help them access water from deeper soil layers. These plants play an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and preventing erosion in their native habitats.
